üåÄ Living Lesson: Understanding Recursion

Understanding Level: 0% | Interactions: 0

üìö What is Recursion?

üßÆ Sal Khan

Let's start simple: Recursion is when a function calls itself. Think of it like looking into two mirrors facing each other - you see reflections within reflections.

Try It: Count Down

function countDown(n) {
    if (n <= 0) {
        console.log("Done!");
        return;
    }
    console.log(n);
    countDown(n - 1);
}
Click the button to see recursion in action!

üé® Visualizing Recursion

üéÆ Don Hopkins

The best way to understand recursion is to see it. Watch how each recursive call creates a new "frame" on the call stack.

Stack Visualization

üê¢ Building Recursive Art

üê¢ Seymour Papert

Children learn by building. Let's create a recursive fractal tree - each branch creates smaller branches, just like in nature.

Fractal Tree Generator

üåç Recursion for Everyone

üèóÔ∏è Hadi Partovi

Every student deserves to understand recursion. Here are multiple ways to think about it - find the one that clicks for you.

üìÅ File System Analogy

Folders contain folders contain folders...

üé≠ Russian Dolls

Each doll contains a smaller version of itself

üìñ Story within a Story

A book about someone reading a book about...

üå≥ Family Tree

Each person has parents who have parents...
